abstract: Government-appointed panel recommends depression screening for women both during pregnancy and after birth, first time it has advocated evaluation for maternal mental illness; endorsement follows studies showing so-called postpartum depression is more common and begins earlier than previously thought, often taking hold during pregnancy; recommendation, published in JAMA, is given 'B' rating, which requires that it be covered under Affordable Care Act.

headline.print_headline: Panel Urges Screening for Maternal Depression
headline.main: Panel Calls for Depression Screenings During and After Pregnancy

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

snippet: The recommendation is expected to galvanize many more health providers to provide screening for women during pregnancy and after giving birth.
